item.title: Danielle add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Death ends a life, not a relationship." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "Like some wines our love could neither mature nor travel." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Francois Sagon
item.description: "I have loved to the point of madness; that which is called madness, that which to me, is the only sensible way to love." -- Francois Sagon

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Listen--are you breathing just a little, and calling it a life?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "To pay attention, this is our endless and proper work." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Hello, sun in my face. Hello you who made the morning and spread it over the fields...Watch, now, how I start the day in happiness, in kindness." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Johann wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "If I love you, what business is it of yours?" -- Johann wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "You should never hesitate to trade your cow for a handful of magic beans." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Sometimes the questions are complicated and the answers are simple." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Today you are You, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is Youer than You." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "If things start happening, don't worry, don't stew, just go right along and you'll start happening too." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Today was good. Today was fun. Tomorrow is another one." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Adults are just obsolete children and the hell with them." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "If you never did you should. These things are fun and fun is good." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "All alone! Whether you like it or not, alone is something you'll be quite a lot!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "When beetles fight these battles in a bottle with their paddles and the bottle's on a poodle and the poodle's eating noodles... ...they call this a muddle puddle tweetle poodle beetle noodle bottle paddle battle." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "ASAP. Whatever that means. It must mean, 'Act swiftly awesome pacyderm!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "So the writer who breeds more words than he needs, is making a chore for the reader who reads." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The storm starts, when the drops start dropping When the drops stop dropping then the storm starts stopping." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses who are only waiting to see us act, just once, with beauty and courage. Perhaps everything that frightens us is, in its deepest essence, something helpless that wants our love." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "The work of the eyes is done. Go now and do the heart-work on the images imprisoned within you." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Find out the reason that commands you to write; see whether it has spread its roots into the very depth of your heart; confess to yourself you would have to die if you were forbidden to write." -- Rainer Maria Rilke
